content.title: NON-DISCLOSURE AGREEMENT (ONE-WAY)
content.recitals: The Discloser wishes to disclose Confidential Information to the Recipient for the Purpose. The Recipient agrees to keep such information confidential on the terms below.

key_clauses.definition:
1. DEFINITIONS
'Confidential Information' means all information disclosed by the Discloser including technical data, trade secrets, know-how, business plans, customer lists, and financial information.
'Purpose' means [PURPOSE - e.g., evaluating a potential business relationship].
key_clauses.obligations:
2. OBLIGATIONS
2.1 The Recipient shall keep Confidential Information secret and not disclose it to third parties.
2.2 The Recipient shall use Confidential Information solely for the Purpose.
2.3 The Recipient may disclose to employees/advisers on a need-to-know basis under equivalent confidentiality.
2.4 The Recipient shall protect Confidential Information with the same care as its own confidential information (minimum: reasonable care).
key_clauses.exclusions:
3. EXCLUSIONS
Obligations do not apply to information that:
(a) Is publicly available (other than by Recipient's breach)
(b) Was lawfully in Recipient's possession before disclosure
(c) Is independently developed by Recipient
(d) Is lawfully received from a third party without restriction
(e) Must be disclosed by law/court order (with prior notice to Discloser if permitted)
key_clauses.term:
4. TERM
This Agreement continues for [TERM - e.g., 2 years] from the date of disclosure. Confidentiality obligations survive for [SURVIVAL - e.g., 5 years] after termination.
key_clauses.return:
5. RETURN OF INFORMATION
On request or termination, Recipient shall return/destroy all Confidential Information and certify compliance.
key_clauses.no_rights:
6. NO RIGHTS GRANTED
This Agreement does not grant any intellectual property rights or create any partnership/employment relationship.
key_clauses.remedies:
7. REMEDIES
Breach may cause irreparable harm. Discloser may seek injunctive relief in addition to damages.
key_clauses.governing_law:
8. GOVERNING LAW
English law. Courts of England and Wales have exclusive jurisdiction.
